import React from "react" import Modal from 'react-modal'; export type Props = { isOpen: boolean onRequestClose: () => void style: object } const InfoModal: React.FC = ({isOpen, onRequestClose, style}) => { Modal.setAppElement('#root'); return (
X

Who is behind this project?

I am Lisa, a Ukrainian web developer from Kharkiv, who has lived in Germany for the past 16 years.

What was my motivation for this project?

Since the beginning of the war people all over Ukraine united and cooperated to provide help to vulnerable people as well as our Army.

People spend their time and money to provide help to the vulnerable, support our Army with medicine, food and defensive weapons. Well-known funds, such as Serhiy Pritula Foundation, also provide far-reaching and valuable humanitarian help and help with defensive weapons.

I want to give people who don't speak Ukrainian or Russian an opportunity to get to know and to donate directly to local volunteers. Money donated to big funds as well as foreign financial help doesn't trickle down to grassroot initiatives, so that direct support is crucial.

How are charities/orgs being selected?

I manually select and verify them. Some of them (like Come Back Alive) are well-established, while some have come into existence only recently. However, all of them provide reports on where the money is being spent (albeit some smaller initiatives only in Ukrainian/Russian and in their Instagram stories).
) } export default InfoModal
